w3afrun.w3af-version: w3af - Web Application Attack and Audit Framework Version: 1.6.45 Revision: 844afb5f47 - 23 Feb 2015 21:10 Branch: develop Local changes: No Author: Andres Riancho and the w3af team.

vulnerability.name: Cross site scripting vulnerability
vulnerability.description: A Cross Site Scripting vulnerability was found at: "http://192.168.1.33:8082/xss/reflect/js3_notags", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "in=c2zs2%2F%2A" The modified parameter was "in". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 88.

header.content: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; w3af.org)

httpresponse.body:
Hello!
This test demonstrates exploitable Injection into JS executable context, with < and > (tag characters) filtered out.

vulnerability.name: Cross site scripting vulnerability
vulnerability.description: A Cross Site Scripting vulnerability was found at: "http://192.168.1.33:8082/xss/reflect/js6_sq", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "in=diqbx%60diqbx" The modified parameter was "in". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 96.

header.content: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; w3af.org)

httpresponse.body:
Hello!
This test demonstrates exploitable Injection due to unsafe handling of single quotes inside of a Javascript block.

vulnerability.name: Cross site scripting vulnerability
vulnerability.description: A Cross Site Scripting vulnerability was found at: "http://192.168.1.33:8082/xss/reflect/enc2_fp", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "in=szypc%60szypc" The modified parameter was "in". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 119.

header.content: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; w3af.org)

httpresponse.body:
Hello!
Injection in Javascript with both double quotes and backslash escaped with backslash - not exploitable .

vulnerability.name: Cross site scripting vulnerability
vulnerability.description: A Cross Site Scripting vulnerability was found at: "http://192.168.1.33:8082/xss/reflect/raw1_fp", using HTTP method GET. The sent data was: "in=tugge%3C%2F-%3E" The modified parameter was "in". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 191.

header.content: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; w3af.org)

httpresponse.body:
<!DOCTYPE html> <html><head><title>Reflected raw tags (raw.1)</title>
</head><body>
Hello! This is a test for potential false positive on raw tags echoed. In this case, the injection is echoed inside of a quoted Javascript string (see page source).
<script type="text/javascript">function foo() {a="some text with tugge</-> tag inside Javascript quoted string (false positive)"}</script>
</body></html>
